{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3045216,"name":"thomas ","username":"tomm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tomm/{size}/189873_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-17T04:25:14.081Z","cooked":"

This is my teams first year using the Flipped Gearboxes from WCP. The first stage is 10:60, and the second stage is 16:32. We had no issues with them during our Week 3 event, even after playing heavy defense almost every match. After the event, we inspected the gearboxes for damage, and nothing was visibly wrong.

We played even more defense during our Week 6 event. Everything was fine until one of our last qualification matches when the 16t gear on the left gearbox shattered. This failure really wasn’t surprising to us after 25 matches of wear. We had two spares (purchased in January 2022), so we replaced it. We didn’t have any problems until semi-finals when the 16t gear on the right side gearbox shattered.

image467×597 48.7 KB

We scrambled to replace it with our last spare. Because we were rushing, our gearbox wasn’t mounted properly which led to the 16t gears teeth being chewed down, but it did not shatter.

We left our Week 6 event assuming that the gears had just been worn down over time (causing the failure) and ordered 4 replacement 16t gears. The night before district champs, we completely reassembled the gearboxes and made sure the directions were followed perfectly. We replaced the right side with a brand new gear (ordered on 4/11), and kept the gear on the left side because we had just replaced it.

At district champs, nothing was wrong until our 11th qualification when the right side gear failed. Although we were a little disappointed, we replaced it (with a gear purchased on 4/11) and continued to play some hard defense.

We were picked by the 8th seed alliance, and we knew we would need to shut down the 1st seed’s alliance captain, 230. We defended 230 until there was about 60 seconds left in the match, and guess what? the right side gear failed again.

We had about 30 minutes to replace the gear, which was doable. We even used our timeout to make sure that everything was tightened and greased properly. With this extra time, we removed the chain driving our front wheels in an attempt to reduce stress on the gearbox. After another minute of defending 230, the right gear failed again.

Basically, my question is, do you think the gears we ordered on 4/11 were bad? It doesn’t make sense that the gears from January lasted over 10 times as long as the ones from April. I plan on emailing WCP tomorrow morning and asking them, but I’m interested if anybody else has had similar experiences with the same gears ordered in the past couple weeks.

We plan on staying away from the 16t gears if we use the same gearboxes next year, and I recommend other teams doing the same.

popped","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3045217,"name":"R.C.","username":"R.C","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/r.c/{size}/264998_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-17T04:29:07.277Z","cooked":"

Tl;Dr

The 16t has a very small amount of material between the hex edge and the root of the gear profile that has led to a few reports of them shattering.

We plan to make an update where customers cannot select that gear and do group kits like we have done on the new products

With brushless motors, we are moving most if not all gearboxes to default steel gears with safer gear ratios.

Suggestions:

  1. update to the 18t ratio.
  2. we have a thunderhex version of the 16t that may fix this issue if you need to use a 16t to make your gear ratio work.

Firstly, thank you for your quick response and yes, I 100% agree with you and we plan on switching to the 18t gears in the future. My main concern is how quickly the gears we ordered this month failed compared to the ones from January. The gears ordered in January made it through over 25 matches, whereas the ones from April barely made it through a match. If there is a manufacturing error with these gears, I would like to make sure the extra one doesn’t end up on a future mechanism. Thank you so much!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-04-17T04:39:11.236Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":287,"readers_count":286,"score":67.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409105,"topic_slug":"gears-shattering-on-wcp-ss-flipped-gearbox-bad-batch-of-gears","display_username":"thomas ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9979,"username":"R.C","name":"R.C.","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/r.c/{size}/264998_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37315,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3x charge stations broken, 11x cubes popped"},"post_url":"/t/gears-shattering-on-wcp-ss-flipped-gearbox-bad-batch-of-gears/409105/3","custom_user_title":"3x charge stations broken, 11x cubes popped","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3045222,"name":"R.C.","username":"R.C","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/r.c/{size}/264998_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-17T04:44:17.966Z","cooked":"

It’s less likely a mfg error since that lot is the same from 2020.

It’s probably more of how the robot is being used etc… Not that it’s your fault but the gear is undersized with bldc motors and we plan to make it not available for teams to pick.

We do plan to test the 16t thex gear extensively this summer to see if it’s a good replacement.

Makes sense and thanks for the help, other than this issue, the gearboxes have been fantastic.

We broke those same gears during practice before our first regional. We replaced them with the 18 tooth ones and have had no trouble through 2 regionals and lots of practice. Those 16s are just really thin, especially where the point of the hex happens to line up with the dip between gear teeth.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-04-17T04:53:45.809Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":59.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409105,"topic_slug":"gears-shattering-on-wcp-ss-flipped-gearbox-bad-batch-of-gears","display_username":"Ben Thorsgard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8365,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"876"},"post_url":"/t/gears-shattering-on-wcp-ss-flipped-gearbox-bad-batch-of-gears/409105/6","custom_user_title":"876","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3045257,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-17T06:35:04.632Z","cooked":"

Related to the theme of BLDC requiring ecosystem updates… The original three miniCIM SS gearbox runs a 3/8 hex for the first internal power transfer shaft, our alliance partner at SVR sheared it clean across (because three falcons). Figure it Needs to be half inch at least, but haven’t run my own numbers.

We had 2x falcon on flipped SS and sheared aluminum final reduction output gears on both sides at our second regional (22/24, 17fps overall).
First one was a weird one, we think a loose bolt got tangled in it, but the second we threw a chain, locked up against the standoff, and shredded the aluminum gear while the final shaft was locked by the chain.

Going steel moving forward, which we had on hand as spares. Glad you’re already making the recommendation to teams.
